title: Susan Boyle beams in tour rehearsals with Jai McDowall
text:
Susan is getting ready for the Ten tour (Picture: PA)

Susan Boyle is getting ready to go on the road, and the Britain’s Got Talent star was smiles as rehearsals for her Ten tour kicked off.

The singer is set to embark on her Ten tour in 2020, which will play in 15 cities around the UK.

She will be joined by Jai, who won Britain’s Got Talent in 2011 and signed a recording contract with Syco.

New pictures show the much loved singer fine-tuning her voice in rehearsals, looking chic in a pale pink jacket and blue jeans.

The 58-year-old said she ‘can’t wait’ to perform for her fans again next year and teased that they will be getting something pretty special.

She said: ‘I was looking forward to my tour, but getting into the studio and rehearsing and coming up with exciting new material and suggestions, I can’t wait to get back on that stage.

‘I’m also looking forward to Jai joining as well. This will be an all-new show, like nothing you’ve seen me do before.’

Susan Boyle has begun rehearsals for her Ten tour (Picture: PA)

Susan will be touring the UK in 2020 (Picture: PA)

Jai added: ‘After a very successful first rehearsal with Susan I am beyond excited to start the tour it’s going to be incredible and the fans are in for a real treat, can’t wait to hit the road in March 2020.’

Ten, Susan’s first tour in four years, will start in March 3.

Susan’s stops also include Nottingham, Bristol, Birmingham and Manchester, before ending in Boyle’s home city of Edinburgh on March 25.

It comes after the release of her album, also called Ten, released back in May.

Susan is joined by Jai McDowall who won Britain’s Got Talent in 2011 (Picture: PA)

Former Britain’s Got Talent winner Jai, 33, previously told Metro.co.uk how he spent his £100,000 prize money.

Rather than splurging on designer items or flashy cars, McDowall put it towards his future and paid off the mortgage on his home after struggling financially.

But he didn’t keep all the wealth to himself, sharing some of it with his brother and sister and contributing to his parents’ holiday.

‘I try and make sure I do stuff for them because I’ve been really lucky and blessed to have the ability to do what I do. I wouldn’t be there without my family, they’ve been so supportive over the years and still are.’
